CHRISTMAS FARE - A fifteen-minute
program with music which contrasts
Christmas celebrations of today
with those of the Elizabethan and
Victorian periods. Ancient recipes
recall the days of sumptuous
festivity while party games take
the listener back to the Victorian
era.
THE TAILOR OF GLOUCESTER - A half-
hour program "Eased da the Beatrix
Potter soory of the mouse who was
befriended by a sick tailor and re¬
paid his debt by Christmas Day,
THE LITTLE LOG SELLERS - 30 minutes -
a cameo cartoon including special
music by the BBC's Northern* Orchestra
and the Manchester Cathedral Choir,
THE PaRABLE - A fifteen-minute pro¬
gram by the well-known religious
writer, Joseph McCulloch,
All programs listed above have been recorded in London and
shipped to New York for distribution. They are available
on disc or tape at a cost of «$5,00 per program.
